channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bollard out of position, 1st July
item.description:
A bollard restricting vehicle access on Waterfall Walk is no longer in position leaving the path vulnerable to unauthorised vehicle access and dangerous for both pedestrians & cyclists as there is a large hole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfall Walk, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

On entering the road from Chelsfield Road, fencing is on the right hand side thx

item.title: Abandoned vehicle for over a year now, 1st July
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle, been just sat there for 18 months has tax but no mot so is illegally parked and should not be on a public road thames water doing essential works ,all cars have been moved except this one because it's been abandoned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Pavement sinkhole opening up, 1st July
item.description:
Outside on the pavement of Cyrius House 15 Bardsley Lane. The tarmac has started melting and sinkhole has opened up. Itâ€™s about 12 inches and looks like it may get bigger in the heat.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Bardsley Lane, London

item.title: Abandoned case and rubbish, 1st July
item.description:
There is an abandoned large suitcase containing items plus other objects placed behind telephone connection hub box. There is also lots of general rubbish lying around in the same area - a large pizza box on the pavement which is a hazard for pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Genoa Road, Anerley, London

item.title: The pedestrian light, 1st July
item.description:
The pedestrian light doesn't seem to be working, traffic lights work but are not stopping for the green man. Pedestrians are having to go when they think safe rather than traffic stopping
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsway, Holborn, City of Westminster

item.title: Outside 213 chevening road, 1st July
item.description:
A large pot of white builders paint has spilled on the pavement. Obstructing the pavement. It is still wet and one cannot pass with a dog or pram without going through it. If you are alone you need to walk close to the tree to avoid getting paint on you. The pot has also been dumped

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking pavement outside 231 Kilburn High Road flat entrance on Burton road, 1st July

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London

item.title: Burnt car blocking out drive, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Like bikes blocking staff room access, 1st July
item.description:
As you can see in the photos, there are more than 15 bikes left abandoned and parked in the wrong place. This is at Monument Piazza, where we have staff room. The bikes blocking staff access. This has been reported numerous times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned green bin, 1st July
item.description:
An extra green bin has been left on the street since 2024, in between 45 and 43 Mycenae Rd. Both those houses already have green bins, it may have been lost from somewhere else and replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Mycenae Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
